session.description: Session bean handling core CA function,signing certificates
Session bean handling hard token data, both about hard tokens and hard token issuers.

env-entry.description: The JDBC datasource to be used

session.description: Session bean handling interface with service configuration
Session bean handling core CA function,signing certificates
Authenticates users towards a user database.
Session bean handling hard token data, both about hard tokens and hard token issuers.
Administrates users in the database using UserData Entity Bean.

env-entry.description: Defines the sender of the notification message
Defines the subject used in the notification message

Defines the actual message of the notification. Use the values $Username, $Password, $CN, $O, $OU, $C, $DATE to indicate which texts that should be replaced (Case insensitive), $NL stands for newline.
env-entry.env-entry-value: Hello ${CN}${NL}${NL} This is a notification. ${NL}${NL} Your username: ${USERNAME}${NL} password: ${PASSWORD}${NL}${NL} Your are NOT supposed to go and fetch your certificate, this is only a test.

session.description: Session bean handling userdata queue for hard token issuers

env-entry.description: The JDBC datasource to be used

session.description: Stores certificate and CRL in the local database using Certificate and CRL Entity Beans.

env-entry.description: Enable or disable protection of database entrys

session.description: Session bean handling interface with user data sources
Stores certificate and CRL in the local database using Certificate and CRL Entity Beans.

env-entry.description: Enable or disable protection of database entrys

session.description: The upgrade session bean is used to upgrade the database between ejbca releases.
Session bean handling core CA function,signing certificates

env-entry.description: Name of PRNG algorithm used for random source - refer to Appendix A in the Java Cryptography Architecture API Specification And Reference for information about standard PRNG algorithm names
The size in octets of the certificate serial numbers. We recommend to use 64 bit serial numbers.

session.description: For some setups there are requirements for integrity protection of database rows.

env-entry.description: If we should warn if a protection row is missing

session.description: Stores key recovery data.
Session bean handling interface with publisher data
Session bean handling interface with user data sources
Timed Object Session bean running the services
Stores data used by web server clients.
Session bean handling interface with ra authorization

env-entry.description: Custom Available Access Rules, use ';' to separate multiple accessrules

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents a publisher

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from PublisherDataBean a WHERE a.name=?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from PublisherDataBean a

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity containing historical record over data user to generate a users certificate

cmp-field.description: DN of issuer of certificate Should be used outside of entity bean, use getCertReqHistory instead
Fingerprint of certificate Should be used outside of entity bean, use getCertReqHistory instead
Serialnumber formated as BigInteger.toString() Should be used outside of entity bean, use getCertReqHistory instead
Date formated as seconds since 1970 (== Date.getTime()) Should be used outside of entity bean, use getCertReqHistory instead
UserDataVO in xmlencoded String format Should be used outside of entity bean, use getCertReqHistory instead
username in database Should be used outside of entity bean, use getCertReqHistory instead

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from CertReqHistoryDataBean a WHERE a.issuerDN=?1 AND a.serialNumber=?2
SELECT OBJECT(a) from CertReqHistoryDataBean a WHERE a.username=?1

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents a Table Protection entry with accompanying data

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from TableProtectDataBean a WHERE a.dbType=?1 AND a.dbKey=?2

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents a Log Entry with accompanying data

cmp-field.description: The id of the CA performing the event.
Indicates the module (CA,RA ...) using the logsession bean.
If you are using Weblogic and Oracle add: column-name="comment_" to the end of the ejb persistense line.

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents a profile

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from EndEntityProfileDataBean a WHERE a.profileName=?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from EndEntityProfileDataBean a

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents a hard token issuer with accompanying data

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from HardTokenIssuerDataBean a WHERE a.alias=?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from HardTokenIssuerDataBean AS a

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents a Log Entry with accompanying data
This enterprise bean entity represents a hard token to certificate mappings

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from HardTokenCertificateMapBean a WHERE a.tokenSN=?1

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents a publisher

cmp-field.description: from SecConst.CA_XX
When was this CA updated in the database

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from CADataBean a WHERE a.name=?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from CADataBean a

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents a user data source

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from UserDataSourceDataBean a WHERE a.name=?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from UserDataSourceDataBean a

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents a hard token to certificate mappings

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from HardTokenPropertyDataBean a WHERE a.id =?1 AND a.property=?2
SELECT OBJECT(a) from HardTokenPropertyDataBean a WHERE a.property =?1 AND a.value=?2

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents an authorization usergroup

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from AdminGroupDataBean a WHERE a.adminGroupName=?1 AND a.caId=?2
SELECT OBJECT(a) from AdminGroupDataBean a

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents a service configuration

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from ServiceDataBean a WHERE a.name=?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from ServiceDataBean a

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents a CRL with accompanying data

cmp-field.description: -1 for a normal CRL and 1 for a deltaCRL

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from CRLDataBean a WHERE a.issuerDN=?1 AND a.crlNumber=?2

entity.description: Stores key recovery data

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from KeyRecoveryDataBean a WHERE a.username=?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from KeyRecoveryDataBean a WHERE a.username=?1 AND a.markedAsRecoverable=TRUE

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents a ra admins user preference.
This enterprise bean entity represents a user entity
This enterprise bean entity represents an access rule
This enterprise bean entity represents a hard token with accompanying data

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from HardTokenDataBean a WHERE a.username=?1

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents a Log Entry with accompanying data

cmp-field.description: Returns clear text password or null.
Returns hashed password or null.
Returns the time when the user was created.
Returns the time when the user was last modified.
Returns the end entity profile id the user belongs to.
Returns the certificate profile id that should be generated for the user.
Returns the token type id that should be generated for the user.
Returns the hard token issuer id that should genererate for the users hard token.
Non-searchable information about a user.

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from UserDataBean a WHERE a.subjectDN=?1 AND a.caId=?2
SELECT OBJECT(a) from UserDataBean a WHERE a.subjectDN=?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from UserDataBean a WHERE a.subjectEmail=?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from UserDataBean a WHERE a.status=?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from UserDataBean a

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents a CRL with accompanying data

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from CertificateProfileDataBean a WHERE a.certificateProfileName=?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from CertificateProfileDataBean AS a

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents global configuration of ra administration

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from GlobalConfigurationDataBean a WHERE a.configurationId=?1

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents an approval request or approved request

cmp-field.description: unique row id
Constructed from action data as actiontype, admin, username etc.
Type of action that should be approved, should be one of ApprovalDataVO.APPROVALTYPE_ constants ex: ApprovalDataVO.APPROVALTYPE_ADDUSER
For RA specific approval requests should the related end entity profile id be specified for non ra request should this field be set to ApprovalDataVO.ANY_ENDENTITYPROFILE
For CA specific approval requests should the related ca id be specified for non ca request should this field be set to ApprovalDataVO.ANY_CA
The issuerdn of the administrator certificate that generated the request.
The serialnumber of the administrator certificate that generated the request.
Should be one of ApprovalDataVO.STATUS_WAITINGFORAPPROVAL, STATUS_APPROVED, STATUS_REJECTED, STATUS_EXPIRED
Stringrepresentation of data of approvals made by one or more administrators
Data containing information about the request displayed for the approval administrator.
Date the request for approval were added
Date the request for action or the approvel action will expire, Long.MAX_VALUE means that the request/approval never expires
Indicates the number of approvals that remains in order to execute the action

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from ApprovalDataBean a WHERE a.approvalId=?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from ApprovalDataBean a WHERE (a.status>-3) and a.approvalId=?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from ApprovalDataBean a

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents an access rule

cmp-field.description: Method returning the newest authorizationtreeupdatenumber.

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents a certificate with accompanying data

cmp-field.description: DN of issuer of certificate
DN of subject in certificate
Fingerprint of certificate
Fingerprint of CA certificate
status of certificate, ex CertificateData.CERT_ACTIVE
What type of user the certificate belongs to, ex SecConst.USER_ENDUSER
Serialnumber formated as BigInteger.toString()
Date formated as seconds since 1970 (== Date.getTime())
Set to date when revocation occured if status== CERT_REVOKED.
Set to revocation reason if status== CERT_REVOKED
certificate itself
username in database

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from CertificateDataBean a WHERE a.expireDate<?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from CertificateDataBean a WHERE a.subjectDN=?1 AND a.issuerDN=?2
SELECT OBJECT(a) from CertificateDataBean a WHERE a.subjectDN=?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from CertificateDataBean a WHERE a.serialNumber=?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from CertificateDataBean a WHERE a.issuerDN=?1 AND a.serialNumber=?2
SELECT OBJECT(a) from CertificateDataBean a WHERE a.username=?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from CertificateDataBean a WHERE a.username=?1 AND a.status=?2 ORDER BY a.expireDate DESC, a.serialNumber DESC

entity.description: This enterprise bean entity represents a hard token profile with accompanying data

query.ejb-ql: SELECT OBJECT(a) from HardTokenProfileDataBean a WHERE a.name=?1
SELECT OBJECT(a) from HardTokenProfileDataBean a
